summary: Completed comprehensive testing of HEIC file converter application. Backend API endpoints are functional with proper validation and error handling. Frontend UI is well-designed and responsive with working file upload, drag-and-drop, format selection, and reset functionality. Backend-frontend integration works correctly, though actual HEIC conversion requires real HEIC files for full validation.

minor_bugs.issue: OPTIONS requests return 405 Method Not Allowed instead of proper CORS preflight response
minor_bugs.impact: May cause CORS issues in some browsers, though actual POST requests work fine

integration_issues.issue: JavaScript runtime errors appear in browser console during error handling

passed_tests: API health check and basic connectivity
File validation - correctly rejects non-HEIC files
Invalid output format validation - returns proper 400 error
Missing file validation - returns proper 422 error
All conversion endpoints accessible (JPEG, PNG, PDF)
Frontend page loading and UI rendering
File upload area clickable and functional
Drag and drop file upload functionality
Format selection dropdown with all options (JPEG, PNG, PDF)
Convert button appears and is enabled after file selection
Reset functionality clears UI state properly
File type validation in frontend (rejects invalid files)
Responsive design with proper feature cards and gradient styling
Backend-frontend integration (API calls work, expect 500 with mock files)

success_percentage.backend: 87% (7/8 tests passed - minor CORS OPTIONS issue)
success_percentage.frontend: 95% (19/20 tests passed - minor JS error handling issue)

action_item_for_main_agent: 1. Fix JavaScript error handling in frontend conversion flow to prevent console errors. 2. Consider adding proper OPTIONS method handling for CORS preflight requests. 3. Test with actual HEIC files to validate complete conversion functionality. The core application is working well and ready for real HEIC file testing.
